column4: can anyone help me that if i do  suspend then my system still consumes same power as in general. what should i do so that it uses power just to keep ram alive.
Hibernate instead.
i dont want to hibernate
i want something like standby as we have in windows
help
help?
is this your first Ubuntu install on that computer?
If not, has standby had different results in the past?
yes
this is only install of ubuntu under windows
Alright, had to check. It may be that some devices on your computer don't directly support standby mode under linux.
It's been quite some time since I've owned a laptop, so I'm not entirely sure how much help I can be here.
ok

The best solution I can give is to use hibernate instead until Google-fu provides you with something better, but that doesn't exactly work well if you're looking to have the laptop go to standby when you shut the lid (or similar situations).
what is Google -fu
Google-fu is the art of using Google to hunt down a solution.
can u explain me?
so i can check myself
Start by searching for 'ubuntu standby problem', refine your search if need be with your laptop's manufacturer and/or model number.
Most importantly, be prepared to read. A lot.
yeah but how use Google -fu
Google-fu isn't a site, it's a term for general knowledge of Google or other search engines applied to find a result.
ok means that just check the thing in google.com .  I thought this might be a channel
Correct, I wasn't implying that you go anywhere you wouldn't normally.
